# Respondents Demographics

## Map of Respondents Across Provinces

The map used provinces as telephone number prefixes were associated with provinces. The current county administration is maintained but overlayed by each provinces having a similar color corresponding to the density of respondents on what would had been the provinces.

```{r echo= FALSE, fig.dim=c(8,6)}
##Prepare Map
#Responses Map Shape File
KEN_gadm_1 <- getData("GADM", country = 'KEN', level=1)
KEN_gadm_19 <- fortify(KEN_gadm_1, region="NAME_1")
Kenya_Provinces <- read_excel("Kenya Provinces.xlsx") #Provinces were added manually as no longer administrative division
KEN_gadm_2 <- merge(KEN_gadm_19, Kenya_Provinces, by=c("id"))

KEN_gadm_2$piece <- as.factor(KEN_gadm_2$piece)
KEN_gadm_2$group <- as.factor(KEN_gadm_2$group)
KEN_gadm_2$prov <- as.factor(KEN_gadm_2$prov)


#Aggregate Responses by State
KEN_Map <- plyr::count(Kenya_RoundM$`Q1. Region (Multiple Choice Question)`)
names(KEN_Map) <- c("prov","Respondents")
KEN_gadm_2 <- merge(KEN_Map, KEN_gadm_2, by=c("prov"))


#Map Style Function
theme_map1 <- function(...) {theme_minimal() + theme(text = element_text(color = "#22211d"), axis.line = element_blank(), axis.text.x = element_blank(), axis.text.y = element_blank(), axis.ticks = element_blank(), axis.title.x = element_blank(), axis.title.y = element_blank(), panel.grid.minor = element_line(color = "#ebebe5", size = 0.2), panel.grid.major = element_line(color = "#ebebe5", size = 0.2), plot.background = element_rect(fill = "#f5f5f2", color = NA), panel.background = element_rect(fill = "#f5f5f2", color = NA), legend.background = element_rect(fill = "#f5f5f2", color = NA), panel.border = element_blank(),  ... )}


##Region Map
ggplot() +  geom_map(data = KEN_gadm_2, aes(map_id = id, fill = `Respondents`), colour = "white", map = KEN_gadm_19, size = 0.1) +  expand_limits(x = KEN_gadm_19$long, y = KEN_gadm_19$lat) +  geom_polygon() + scale_fill_viridis_c(option = "magma", direction = -1, name = "Respondents \nDensity") + labs(x = NULL, y = NULL, fill = NULL, title = "CRA Kenya 1st Round Respondents Distribution", caption = NULL) + theme_map1() + theme(legend.key = element_rect(colour = "transparent", fill = "white")) + scale_x_discrete(breaks = NULL) + scale_y_continuous(expand = c(0,0), breaks = NULL)  + theme(legend.background = element_rect(fill = alpha('white', 0.0)), legend.text = element_text(size = 7, color = "#4e4d47"), plot.title = element_text(color = "#4e4d47", hjust = 1), legend.title = element_text(size = 8)) + coord_equal()
```

## Sex Distribution

```{r echo= FALSE, fig.dim=c(8,6)}
#Sex
Kenya_Sex <- plyr::count(Kenya_Round1$`Q2. Gender (Multiple Choice Question)`)
Kenya_Sex$Sex_perct <- Kenya_Sex$freq / sum(Kenya_Sex$freq)
Kenya_SexGroup <- Kenya_Round1 %>% count(`Q2. Gender (Multiple Choice Question)`, `Q1. Region (Multiple Choice Question)`)
Kenya_SexGroup <- Kenya_SexGroup %>% group_by(`Q1. Region (Multiple Choice Question)`) %>% mutate(Sex_perct = round(n/sum(n),3))
Kenya_SexGroup2 <- Kenya_Round1 %>% count(`Q1. Region (Multiple Choice Question)`, `Q2. Gender (Multiple Choice Question)`)
names(Kenya_SexGroup2) <- c("Region","Sex","n")
Kenya_SexGroup2 <- Kenya_SexGroup2 %>% group_by(Region) %>% mutate(Sex_perct = round(n/sum(n),3))
Kenya_SexGroup2 <- Kenya_SexGroup2[-c(3)]
Kenya_SexGroup2 <- spread(Kenya_SexGroup2, Sex, Sex_perct)
Kenya_SexGroup3 <- Kenya_Round1 %>% count(`Q1. Region (Multiple Choice Question)`, `Q2. Gender (Multiple Choice Question)`, `Q4. Setting (Multiple Choice Question)`)
Kenya_SexGroup3 <- Kenya_SexGroup3 %>% group_by(`Q1. Region (Multiple Choice Question)`) %>% mutate(Sex_perct = round(n/sum(n),3))
Kenya_SexGroup3 <- Kenya_SexGroup3 %>% group_by(`Q1. Region (Multiple Choice Question)`,`Q2. Gender (Multiple Choice Question)`) %>% mutate(Set_perct = round(n/sum(n),3))
names(Kenya_SexGroup3) <- c("Region","Sex","Set","n","Sex_perct","Set_perct")

##Table Sex

##Dumbbell Plot Sex
Kenya_Sex$Level <- "National" #1 National
Kenya_Sex1 <- Kenya_Sex[-c(2)]
Kenya_Sex2 <- spread(Kenya_Sex1, x, Sex_perct)
Kenya_Sex2$labelF <- paste("Female\n",round(100*(Kenya_Sex2$Female),2),"%")
Kenya_Sex2$labelM <- paste("Male\n",round(100*(Kenya_Sex2$Male),2),"%")
  
ggplot(Kenya_Sex2, aes(x=Male, xend=Female, y=Level, group=Level)) + 
        geom_dumbbell(color="#F7BC08", 
                      size=2.5, 
                      colour_x = "#395B74") +  
        scale_x_continuous(label=percent) + 
        labs(x=NULL, y=NULL, 
             title="Sex Respondents Distribution", 
             subtitle="Female and Male Respondents Proportion at National Level") +
        theme(plot.title = element_text(hjust=0.5, face="bold"),
              plot.background=element_rect(fill="#f7f7f7"),
              panel.background=element_rect(fill="#f7f7f7"),
              panel.grid.minor=element_blank(),
              panel.grid.major.y=element_blank(),
              panel.grid.major.x=element_line(),
              axis.ticks=element_blank(),
              legend.position="top",
              panel.border=element_blank()) + coord_cartesian(xlim = c(0.25, 0.75)) + geom_text( data = filter(Kenya_Sex2, Level == "National"), aes(x = Female, y = Level), label = Kenya_Sex2$labelF, fontface = "bold", color = "#F7BC08",
vjust = -0.75, hjust = 0.75) + geom_text( data = filter(Kenya_Sex2, Level == "National"), aes(x = Male, y = Level), label = Kenya_Sex2$labelM, fontface = "bold", color = "#395B74", vjust = -0.75, hjust = 0.75) + theme_clean() 

Kenya_SexGroup <- Kenya_SexGroup[-c(3)]

```

## COVID-19 Protective Measures Practice

```{r echo= FALSE, fig.dim=c(8,6)}

#Handwashing, Mask Use, and Social Distance

KEN_LikertHandwashing <- plyr::count(Kenya_Round1$`Q5. Handwashing Frequency (Multiple Choice Question)`)
KEN_LikertHandwashing$Name <- "Handwashing" 
KEN_LikertHandwashing <- spread(KEN_LikertHandwashing, x, freq)
KEN_LikertMask <- plyr::count(Kenya_Round1$`Q6. Face mask wearing Frequency (Multiple Choice Question)`)
KEN_LikertMask$Name <- "Mask Use"
KEN_LikertMask <- spread(KEN_LikertMask, x, freq)
KEN_LikertSocDist <- plyr::count(Kenya_Round1$`Q7. Social Distance Frequency in last month (Multiple Choice Question)`)
KEN_LikertSocDist$Name <- "Social Distance"
KEN_LikertSocDist <- spread(KEN_LikertSocDist, x, freq)
KEN_Likert <- rbind(KEN_LikertHandwashing, KEN_LikertMask)
KEN_Likert <- rbind(KEN_Likert, KEN_LikertSocDist)
names(KEN_Likert) <-c("Practice", "All of \nthe time", "Most of \nthe time", "Sometimes", "Rarely", "Never")
col_order <- c("Practice", "Never", "Rarely", "Sometimes","Most of \nthe time","All of \nthe time")
KEN_Likert <- KEN_Likert[, col_order]

KEN_LikertPlot <-HH::likert(Practice ~ ., data = KEN_Likert, ylab=NULL, as.percent=TRUE, main = list(" Protective Practices CRA COVID-19 \n1st Round Kenya",x=unit(.55, "npc")), sub= list("Frequency of Practice",x=unit(.57, "npc")),xlim=c(-20,0,20,40,60,80,100), col=c("#E94E1B", "#F7AA4E", "#BEBEBE", "#6193CE", "#00508C" ), rightAxis = FALSE)
plot(KEN_LikertPlot)
```

```{r echo= FALSE, fig.dim=c(8,6)}

#Likert by Sex

KEN_LikertMaskSex$Name <- "Mask Use"

KEN_LikertSocDistSex$Name <- "Social Distance" 
KEN_LikertSocDistSex <- spread(KEN_LikertSocDistSex, `Q7. Social Distance Frequency in last month (Multiple Choice Question)`, n)
KEN_LikertSex <- rbind(KEN_LikertHandwashingSex, KEN_LikertMaskSex)
KEN_LikertSex <- rbind(KEN_LikertSex, KEN_LikertSocDistSex)
names(KEN_LikertSex) <-c("Sex","Practice", "All of \nthe time", "Most of \nthe time", "Sometimes", "Rarely", "Never")
```

## Barriers to Protective Practices

```{r echo= FALSE, fig.dim=c(8,6)}
# Barriers

KEN_Barriers <-plyr::count(Kenya_Round1$`Q8. Barriers topracticing protective behaviours (Multiple Choice Question)`)

KEN_Barriers <- KEN_Barriers %>% mutate(perc = round(freq/sum(freq),3))
KEN_Barriers$label <- paste(100 * KEN_Barriers$perc,"%")
names(KEN_Barriers) <- c("Barriers", "Recipients","Percentage","label")

ggplot(KEN_Barriers, aes(reorder (`Barriers`,`Percentage`),`Percentage`, label=`Percentage`)) + geom_point(col="black",size=2) + geom_text(aes(label=label),vjust=- 0.65, color="black", size=3) + labs(title="Barriers to Practice Protective Behaviours", subtitle="Percentages of Respondents per Annotated Barrier") + coord_flip() + geom_segment(aes(x=`Barriers`, xend=`Barriers`, y=0, yend=`Percentage`)) + theme(axis.text.y = element_text(vjust=0.6), axis.title = element_blank()) + scale_y_continuous(labels=c("0%","10%","20%","30%","40%"))
```

## Community Groups' Trust

```{r echo= FALSE, fig.dim=c(8,6)}

#Community Groups Trust - Q18

KEN_GroupsTrust <-plyr::count(Kenya_Round1$`Q18. Which community groups do you trust the most? (Multiple Choice Question)`)
```
